question:
You rent a flat with your friend who is moving out. It is too expensive for you to pay the rent alone.Write a letter to your landlord. In your letter:
•explain the situation
•describe why you would like to stay in this flat
•ask the landlord if you can find another flatmate
text: Being tenant of your flat7, Park Avenue, I am writing this letter to request some changes in the rental agreement.

For over three years, I have been renting this apartment with my friend Geet. However, Geet is moving out next month. She was offered a new job opportunity which she accepted. Therefore, she has to shift to a new city.

Despite this change, I am unwilling to leave this place as it still suits me perfectly. Firstly, it is within a good walking distance of my university as well as its excellent condition. Secondly, this locale is in the heart of the city, consequently, I have never faced any issues regarding shopping, grocery stores, and restaurants.

My difficulty is only rent, which although reasonable, is too high for me to afford to pay alone. I would like to ask your permission to find another flatmate who would share the cost with me. I hope you understand my situation and permit me to search for a new renter.
I look forward to your quick response.
